feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued July 03 at 12:52PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Near Record Warm Temperatures Could Bring High River Levels... A heat wave arrives later this week causing temperatures to soar into the upper 70s and 80s. Warmest temperatures are expected Friday and Saturday. With these warm temperatures, increased snowmelt at elevation will increase runoff into the Chilkat River Basin. Confidence is increasing that the Chilkat River could reach minor
entry.cap:areaDesc: Haines Borough and Klukwan

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 12:16PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Heat Wave Arrives Later This Week... There is an increasing potential for near record high temperatures soaring into the upper 70s and 80s throughout the Panhandle starting Thursday and continuing through Sunday. Warm temperatures will arrive as soon as Monday for some communities across the southern Panhandle, but in general, warmest

The Wisconsin Department of Natural Resources has issued an Air Quality Advisory for Ozone, beginning July 4th at 10 AM CDT and lasting until July 4th at 11:00 PM CDT. This advisory affects people living in the following counties: Columbia, Dane, Dodge, Fond

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued July 03 at 3:21PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 11 PM CDT TUESDAY... The Wisconsin Department of Natural Resources has issued an Air Quality Advisory for Ozone...in effect from 10 AM to 11 PM CDT Tuesday. entry.title: Dense Fog Advisory issued July 04 at 5:03AM EDT until July 04 at 9:00AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Visibility one quarter mile or less in dense fog. * WHERE...Portions of east central Ohio. Portions of northwest, southwest, and western Pennsylvania. Portions of northern West Virginia. * WHEN...Until 9 AM EDT this morning.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Hancock
